alert.note: Alert for Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 8:04PM EDT until September 13 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL TOLLAND, CENTRAL WINDHAM AND NORTHWESTERN PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 804 PM EDT, Doppler radar shows the heavy rainfall from earlier, which produced 2 to almost 5 inches in spots, is coming to an end across the warning area. Ongoing flooding should begin to improve shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woonsocket, Cumberland, Mansfield, Windham, Plainfield, Smithfield, Lincoln, Willimantic, Killingly, Burrillville, North Smithfield, Scituate, Glocester, Putnam, Thompson, Brooklyn, Woodstock, Canterbury, Foster and Ashford. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
